description: Before recently moving to NC, I volunteered with Iona's Senior Daycare Centers. As a volunteer, I assisted with activities and programs for seniors with dementia and other disabilities. I helped facilitate social and recreational activities, provided companionship, and supported the staff in creating a positive experience for participants.

Caretaker for my father who had dementia, Louie Body Dementia, and Parkinson's. I provided support and care for him during his final years. This included day-to-day needs, medical visits, medication management, social & recreational activities, exercise. I researched & implemented evidence-based strategies for promoting cognitive & emotional well-being

An end-to-end loss mitigation management platform for mortgage services. Over four years, I  participated in all aspects of product development lifecycle from planning through execution! I was responsible for developing and maintaining the front-end of each application, working closely with the design team to create seamless user experiences. Most recently, as part of the tech leadership team, I planned, developed, executed, and maintained aspects of a software development life cycle for the frontend/UX with the goal to design and develop robust, scalable, and secure solutions, ensuring high performance and user satisfaction.

Starting out as one of only two frontend engineers, I had a big part in digitizing an 80 year old federal process from 70+ printed pages into a short, dynamic, all-inclusive web-based form and user site.

As the sole in-house software engineer, I managed and led in the development of all Aeroasis software endevours including rebuilding the public website, which resulted in a 200% increase in visitor traffic and improved company SEO. I created and maintained the company shop through Shopify, paypal, and Square. I developed the Aeroasis Grow App: an IoT connected mobile user app that maintained and controled an indoor garden ecosystem. In addition, I developed an education curricula and built a web platform for teachers and educators to access and interact with our lesson plans.

I crafted impactful and engaging online presences for a variety of small businesses. I translated client needs into effective web solutions. Throughout I managed the web application projects and development from conception through launch.

I provided strategic leadership and hands-on management for the museum's community outreach programs, education initiatives and community services. I managed all aspects of a diverse team of educators, interns and volunteers.

I provided public tours for the Museum of Chinese America (MOCA), the Studio Museum of Harlem, and the Rubin Museum of Art. I developed and led special events, activities for school groups, families, and the general public.

I coordinated support services for students in a 5-12 grade public school. This included curriculum development, teacher training, and student support services. I managed and mentored a team of educators. I created and led professional development workshops for teachers and staff. I developed and implemented STEAM (science, tech, engineering, arts, math) curricula, created and led after-school programs, summer program for students in grades 5-12.

I helped found a small school with a focus on STEM education. I advised and taught middle and high school math, social studies, English and literacy, and art in general and special education settings. Additionally, I planned school trips and fostered community partnerships
